questions.question_text: Performing Vulnerability Assessment is an example of a:

discussion.content: Its part of Preparation, the P in PICERL

choices.D: Incident Identification, recording, initial response, containment and communication
choices.B: Incident Identification, initial response, communication, recording and containment
choices.C: Incident Identification, communication, recording, initial response and containment
choices.A: Incident Identification, recording, initial response, communication and containment

questions.question_text: The correct sequence of Incident Response and Handling is:

discussion.content: i think correct answer is -D- Incident Identification, recording, initial response, containment and communication
A is correct cause Comms come after recording and before containment

questions.question_text: Preventing the incident from spreading and limiting the scope of the incident is known as:
A computer Risk Policy is a set of ideas to be implemented to overcome the risk associated with computer security incidents. Identify the procedure that is NOT part of the computer risk policy?

choices.C: Procedure for the ongoing training of employees authorized to access the system
choices.D: Provisions for continuing support if there is an interruption in the system or if the system crashes
choices.B: Procedure to monitor the efficiency of security controls
choices.A: Procedure to identify security funds to hedge risk

discussion.content: I think B as insurance, training and continuity/downtime costs kind of fit the the question. Got to lobe vague questions to try to make straightforward processes complicated to get on that cert grift instead of focusing on fundamentals

Selected Answer: A
Answer should be A. Not fund issue
Answer should be A. Not fund issue

Selected Answer: A
As per book answer is A
A doesn't even remotely mention insurance policy. its just identifying security funds to hedge risk. identify security funds isnt even related to computer risk policy
Definitely the answer here is A. If you even look at the all answers without reading the question, A sticks out like it doesn't belong there.

This is letter A for me.

A. Procedure to identify security funds to hedge risk - This is more on financial/business side. Security doesn't really govern them.
B. Procedure to monitor the efficiency of security controls - Related to risks
C. Procedure for the ongoing training of employees authorized to access the system - by providing ongoing training for employees authorized to access the system, you are teaching them what to do and what not to do. This lowers the risk of those users being part/triggering an incident.
D. Provisions for continuing support if there is an interruption in the system or if the system crashes - related to availability
I think the key is the word "computer" because it is not about human risks.

comments.content: Computer security incidents always involves human

C is not the correct Awnser. 
Training employees IS apart of risk as it reduces human error.

discussion.content: Correct answer is C. Read the wording of question, it is asking about Risk and how do you hedge a risk, by taking insurance policy. So A is not the answer.

I think also the answer is A as budgeting is not part of the risk policy and security awareness training for employees accesing the coorporate computers and networks is very important to narrow the possibilities of human error or fall victim of cyber security scams
I think the answer is letter A
